error.signature: Error [ERR_PACKAGE_PATH_NOT_EXPORTED]: Package subpath './X' is not defined by exports

verdict.summary: Package exports field doesn't expose this subpath. Library changed its exports in a new version.

dead_ends.action: Patch package.json exports field in node_modules
dead_ends.why_fails: Changes will be lost on next npm install

dead_ends.action: Use require() to bypass exports restriction
dead_ends.why_fails: Only works for CJS packages and may break in future

workarounds.action: Check library changelog for the new import path after the update
Pin to the previous version that exposed this subpath
Use the library's public API instead of deep imports
workarounds.how:
// Old: import X from 'lib/internal/x'
// New: import { X } from 'lib'

frequently_confused_with.distinction: '[ERR_PACKAGE_PATH_NOT_EXPORTED]' indicates a reference to an undefined variable, while 'Error' indicates an OpenSSL compatibility issue with older webpack.
